page.title: 08PLASHETT _ ECOLOGY
page.content: The area suffered heavily from the effects of Dutch Elm Disease but both the Parish Council and private individuals have planted many trees in the area to replace those destroyed. Care has been taken in recent years to reduce the cutting of verges to allow animal and plant communities to flourish. In the woodland there is some management with both fencing and felling (with the felled wood being removed. There is little evidence of any chemical polution but high levels of acid rainfall have been recorded in the area. Local people have made a great deal of effort to keep the public footpaths open. There has however been some resistance from a few of the farmers.
